data.question: What is the empirical formula for truncated-octahedral c-(4,12)MTBC-Zr6 crystal nr.1?
What is the space group for tr-(4,12)MTBC-Zr6?
data.answer: P-3c1

data.question: What is the final R index (I>=2Ïƒ (I)) for cubic c-(4,12)MTBC-Zr6 crystal nr.1 after refinement?
What method was used for nitrogen sorption analysis?
data.answer: Quantachrome Instruments Autosorb iQ 3 with nitrogen at 77 K

data.question: What is the BET surface area for the product obtained from MOF_DMA_2d_4 and ZrCl4_GB after 24 h reaction time?
Does increasing the reaction time affect the phase composition of Zr-MTBC MOFs?
data.answer: Yes, increasing the reaction time inversed the phase ratios in the product and more tetragonal and trigonal Zr-MTBC were formed.

data.question: Is the formation of cubic Zr-MTBC observed when using DMA as solvent?
data.answer: No, when employing DMA as solvent instead of DEF, no cubic Zr-MTBC was formed.

data.question: What is the effect of water content on the synthesis of Zr-MTBC MOFs?
data.answer: The amount of water added to the reaction mixture affected the phase composition of the products, with different amounts of water yielding different phases of Zr-MTBC.

data.question: Is the phase composition of Zr-MTBC MOFs significantly affected by the reaction temperature?
data.answer: False, the reaction temperature did not significantly affect the composition of MOF phases formed.

data.question: Can the synthesis conditions lead to a phase transformation from the trigonal to tetragonal phase in Zr-MTBC MOFs?
data.answer: True, longer reaction times favored the formation of tetragonal Zr-MTBC, suggesting a phase transformation from the trigonal to tetragonal phase.

data.question: Does the synthesis of Zr-MTBC MOFs in DMA with the addition of water always yield hexagonal particles?
data.answer: False, synthesis with different amounts of water yielded mixtures of hexagonal and octahedral particles, characteristic for trigonal and tetragonal Zr-MTBC, respectively.

data.question: Is the BET surface area measurement indicative of the porosity of Zr-MTBC MOFs?
data.answer: True, the BET surface area measurement is used to determine the porosity of Zr-MTBC MOFs.

data.question: Does the presence of water in the synthesis of Zr-MTBC MOFs lead to the formation of only one phase?
data.answer: False, the presence of water in the synthesis of Zr-MTBC MOFs affects the phase composition, leading to the formation of different phases.

data.question: Is the reaction temperature a critical factor in determining the crystal habit of Zr-MTBC MOFs?
data.answer: True, the reaction temperature and concentration of reactants can influence the crystal habit of Zr-MTBC MOFs.

data.question: Can the synthesis of Zr-MTBC MOFs result in a mixture of cubic, trigonal, and tetragonal phases?
data.answer: True, the synthesis of Zr-MTBC MOFs can result in a mixture of cubic, trigonal, and tetragonal phases depending on the synthesis conditions.

data.question: What is the crystal system for tr-(4,12)MTBC-Zr6?
data.answer: Trigonal

data.question: What is the role of benzoic acid in the synthesis of Zr-MTBC phases?
data.answer: Benzoic acid is used as a modulator in the synthesis of Zr-MTBC phases.

data.question: What is the significance of the BET surface area measurement in the study of MOFs?
data.answer: The BET surface area measurement is significant as it provides information about the porosity and surface area of MOFs, which are critical for their application in gas storage and catalysis.

data.question: Does the synthesis of Zr-MTBC MOFs in DMA without water yield any product?
data.answer: False, the synthesis of Zr-MTBC MOFs in DMA without water did not yield any product.

data.question: Is the formation of different phases of Zr-MTBC MOFs an example of polymorphism?
data.answer: True, the formation of different phases of Zr-MTBC MOFs from the same molecular building blocks is an example of polymorphism.
